channel.title: Need help with port forwarding
channel.description: ok i did everything correctly when setting up my portforawrding for my runescape private server, but other people and i cannot connect to my server... i set up a no-ip, i portforwarded my router to my computer through port 43594, and i even portforward my modem through to my router... i really need help because nothing i try works.. i tried portforwarding through utorrent also using both 43594 and 5555 ports.. i have no clue what else to do

item.title: Need help with port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @durfx durfx
item.description:
@durfx wrote:

ok i tried that… i set the ports up and everything… exited all my firewalls… and tried the test and got an error…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with port forwarding
item.dc:creator: @JaydenD12 JaydenD12
item.description:
@JaydenD12 wrote:

durfx:

i used the search button before posting this… but they didnt help… and i dont know what else to do

Well, I’ll teach you then.

First, click run.bat and make sure it’s running before you proceed to the following steps.

  1. Open µtorrent.
  2. Goto Options > Preferences
  3. Click on “Connections”
  4. Make sure “Randomize” is ticked.
  5. Input “43594” in the box (there should be a random port in there, just replace it with 43594).
  6. Push “Apply” and “Ok”
  7. Goto Options > Speed guide
  8. Click “Test if port is forwarded properly”.

If it’s done properly it will say

"OK!

Port 43594 is open and accepting connections.

You will be able to receive incoming BitTorrent connections."

If you get “Error” your firewall could be blocking it.

Read full topic
